meanings.definition: A person who receives a mandate or authorization.
meanings.sent1: The mandatary was entrusted with carrying out the instructions.
meanings.sent2: The mandatary signed the contract on behalf of the company.
meanings.sent3: The mandatary mistakenly thought the mandate was to eat all the cookies.
meanings.sent4: As a mandatary of the court, he had to ensure justice was served.
meanings.sent5: The mandatary's role was crucial in executing the will of the deceased.

meanings.definition: Having the nature of a mandate or command.
meanings.sent1: The mandatary order was to be followed without question.
meanings.sent2: The document had a mandatary tone, indicating it was not a suggestion.
meanings.sent3: The mandatary directive left no room for interpretation.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a mandatary gaze that demanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The mandatary presence of the general made everyone stand at attention.
